Package com.nokia.maps.kml

The kml package provides classes to parse and render data from a KML file.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ColorStyle
    This interface represents the abstract <ColorStyle> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Document> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the abstract <Feature> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Folder> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Geometry> abstract tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <hotSpot> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Icon> tag from KML specification.
    IconStyle
    This interface represents the <IconStyle> tag from KML specification.
    KMLFactoryListener
    This interface is used to monitor KMLFactory events.
    KMLParserListener
    This interface is used to monitor KMLManager events.
    LinearRing
    This interface represents the <LinearRing> tag from the KML specification.

    This interface represents the <LineString> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Pair> tag from KML specification.

    This class represents the <Placemark> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <Polygon> tag from KML specification.

    This interface represents the <PolyStyle> tag from KML specification.
    Style
    This interface represents the <Style> tag from KML specification.
    StyleMap
    This interface represents the <StyleMap> tag from KML specification.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    KMLFactory
    This class instantiates all objects used to interact with a KML file.
    KMLManager
    This class is used to convert a KML Document into a KMLResultSet of actual MapObjects

Package com.nokia.maps.kml Description

The kml package provides classes to parse and render data from a KML file.

Keyhole Markup Language (KML) is an standardized XML notation for geographic applications.

KML is able to:

  • Specify icons and labels to identify locations.
  • Specify additional information (e.g. address, phone number) associated with a specific location.
  • Define other elements such as polygons and polylines and attach them to the map.
  • Define styles to specify feature appearance.
  • Write HTML descriptions of features, including hyperlinks and embedded images
  • Use folders for hierarchical grouping of features

Implement a KMLParserListener and a KMLFactoryListener, create a KMLManager and call parseKML()- This will create a KML Document 


        KMLManager parser = KMLManager.getInstance();

        // Could also load the KML file from a URL using:
        // parser.parseKML ("http://api.maps.nokia.com/2.1.0/playground/examples/res/kml/usgs/earthquakes.kml", this );

        parser.parse(getClass().getResourceAsStream("/earthquake.kml"), this);

If successful, convert the KML Document into a KMLResultSet by calling KMLFactory.createKMLResultSet() passing in the received KML Document. 

        
                 public void onParseComplete(KMLManager source, Document document) {
        progressEnd();

        // Attempt to create Map Objects from the parsed KML
        KMLFactory.getInstance(mapFactory).createKMLResultSet(document, this);
    }

If successful, the KMLResultSet.getContainer() will hold a MapContainer which has all your map data as MapObjects. You can add it to the MapDisplay in the usual manner, and zoom as necessary 

        
                 public void onCreateKMLResultSetComplete(KMLFactory source, KMLResultSet resultSet) {
        map.addMapObject(resultSet.getContainer());
        map.zoomTo(resultSet.getContainer().getBoundingBox(), false);
    }

Add an interactive KMLMapComponent as necessary, to receive onFocusChanged() events and interact with the <Placemark> elements, you will need to implement a KMLEventListener and attach the KMLEventListener to the KMLMapComponent of your result set. This obtained from KMLResultSet.getKMLMapComponent() 

        
                KMLMapComponent component = resultSet.getKMLMapComponent();
                component.setEventListener(this);
                map.addMapComponent(component);

An onFocusChanged() event is fired whenever a <Placemark> is moved onto or away from the center of the MapDisplay.
